required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Regulation of Coagulation in Orthopedic Surgery to Prevent Deep Vein Thromboembolism (DVT) and Pulmonary Embolism (PE). A Study of BAY59-7939 in the Prevention of Venous Thrombo Embolism (VTE) in Subjects Undergoing Elective Total Knee Replacement.
clinical_study.official_title: RECORD 4 Study: REgulation of Coagulation in ORthopedic Surgery to Prevent DVT and PE; a Controlled, Double-blind, Randomized Study of BAY59-7939 in the Prevention of VTE in Subjects Undergoing Elective Total Knee Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess if 10 mg BAY59-7939, taken once daily as a tablet, is safe and prevents blood clot which may form after a knee replacement operation.

primary_outcome.measure: Composite Endpoint of Total Venous Thrombo Embolism (VTE) i.e.: Any Deep Vein Thromboembolism (DVT) (Proximal and/or Distal), Non Fatal Pulmonary Embolism (PE), Death of All Causes Per Protocol Population
primary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

primary_outcome.measure: Composite Endpoint of Total VTE i.e.: Any DVT (Proximal and/or Distal), Non Fatal PE, Death of All Causes Per Modified Intent to Treat Population.
primary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint Comprising Proximal DVT, Non-fatal PE and VTE- Related Death (Major VTE) Per Protocol Population of Major VTE
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint Comprising Proximal DVT, Non-fatal PE and VTE- Related Death (Major VTE) Per Modified Intent to Treat Population of Major VTE.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Symptomatic VTE (DVT, PE) Per Protocol Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Symptomatic VTE (DVT, PE) Per Modified Intent to Treat Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of DVT (Proximal, Distal) Per Protocol Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of DVT (Proximal, Distal) Per Modified Intent to Treat Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Symptomatic VTE During Follow-up Per Protocol Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Symptomatic VTE During Follow-up Per Modified Intent to Treat Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: The Composite Endpoint Comprising Major VTE and Treatment-emergent Major Bleeding Per Subjects Valid for Analysis of Net Clinical Benefit
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography, anesthesia and surgery reports, number of transfusions

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint That Results From the Primary Endpoint by Substituting VTE Related Death for All Death Per Protocol Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint That Results From the Primary Endpoint by Substituting VTE Related Death for All Death Per Modified Intent to Treat Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint That Results From Major VTE by Substituting All Cause Mortality for VTE-related Death Per Protocol of Major VTE Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint That Results From Major VTE by Substituting All Cause Mortality for VTE-related Death Per Modified Intent to Treat of Major VTE Population.
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography

secondary_outcome.measure: Treatment-emergent Major Bleedings Per Safety Population.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from start of double-blind study medication to last dose of double-blind study medication plus two days. The average duration of double-blind treatment was 12 days in each treatment group (safety population).
secondary_outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessments of all available information (eg, anesthesia and surgery reports, laboratory results, number of transfusions, autopsy report)

arm_group.description: Rivaroxaban (Xarelto, BAY59-7939) 10 mg tablet administered once daily (od) in the evening plus placebo syringes of enoxaparin twice a day (bid) administered once in the morning and once in the evening.
Placebo tablet of rivaroxaban administered once daily in the evening plus syringes of enoxaparin active substance 30 mg twice a day administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

intervention.description: Rivaroxaban (Xarelto, BAY59-7939) 10 mg tablet administered once daily (od) in the evening.
Syringes of enoxaparin active substance 30 mg twice a day administered once in the morning and once in the evening.
Placebo tablet of rivaroxaban administered once daily in the evening.
Placebo syringes of enoxaparin twice a day (bid) administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients aged 18 years or above
- Patients scheduled for elective total knee replacement
Exclusion Criteria:
- Active bleeding or high risk of bleeding contraindicating treatment with Low Molecular Weight Heparin (LMWH)
- Contraindication listed in the labeling or conditions precluding subject treatment with enoxaparin or requiring dose adjustment (e.g. severe renal impairment, please refer to the local label of enoxaparin in your country)
- Conditions prohibiting bilateral venography (e.g. amputation of 1 leg, allergy to contrast media)

results_reference.citation: Turpie AG, Lassen MR, Davidson BL, Bauer KA, Gent M, Kwong LM, Cushner FD, Lotke PA, Berkowitz SD, Bandel TJ, Benson A, Misselwitz F, Fisher WD; RECORD4 Investigators. Rivaroxaban versus enoxaparin for thromboprophylaxis after total knee arthroplasty (RECORD4): a randomised trial. Lancet. 2009 May 16;373(9676):1673-80. doi: 10.1016/S0140-6736(09)60734-0. Epub 2009 May 4.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The recruitment period was from 16 Jun 2006 to 31 Jan 2008.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 3418 subjects were screened; 270 subjects were screening failures and were not randomized; 3148 subjects were randomized; 114 subjects did not receive medication; 3034 subjects received medication and were included in the safety population

group.title: Rivaroxaban 10 mg Once Daily (OD) (Xarelto, BAY59-7939)
group.description: Rivaroxaban (Xarelto, BAY59-7939) 10 mg tablet administered once daily (od) in the evening plus placebo syringes of enoxaparin twice a day (bid) administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Enoxaparin 30 mg Twice a Day (Bid)
group.description: Placebo tablet of rivaroxaban administered once daily in the evening plus syringes of enoxaparin active substance 30 mg twice a day administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Rivaroxaban 10 mg Once Daily (OD) (Xarelto, BAY59-7939)
group.description: Rivaroxaban (Xarelto, BAY59-7939) 10 mg tablet administered once daily (od) in the evening plus placebo syringes of enoxaparin twice a day (bid) administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Enoxaparin 30 mg Twice a Day (Bid)
group.description: Placebo tablet of rivaroxaban administered once daily in the evening plus syringes of enoxaparin active substance 30 mg twice a day administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
Gender
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
measure.description: One subject in the rivaroxaban 10 mg OD treatment group was missing race.

measure.title: Weight
measure.description: One subject in each treatment group was missing baseline weight.

outcome.title: Composite Endpoint of Total Venous Thrombo Embolism (VTE) i.e.: Any Deep Vein Thromboembolism (DVT) (Proximal and/or Distal), Non Fatal Pulmonary Embolism (PE), Death of All Causes Per Protocol Population
outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography
outcome.population: The primary efficacy analysis was based on the per protocol (PP) population and included subjects who were valid for the modified intent to treat (MITT) population, had an adequate assessment of thromboembolism that, in case of a positive finding, was done not later than 36 hours after stop of study drug, and had no major protocol deviations.

group.title: Rivaroxaban 10 mg Once Daily (OD) (Xarelto, BAY59-7939)
group.description: Rivaroxaban (Xarelto, BAY59-7939) 10 mg tablet administered once daily (od) in the evening plus placebo syringes of enoxaparin twice a day (bid) administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Enoxaparin 30 mg Twice a Day (Bid)
group.description: Placebo tablet of rivaroxaban administered once daily in the evening plus syringes of enoxaparin active substance 30 mg twice a day administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

measure.title: Composite Endpoint of Total Venous Thrombo Embolism (VTE) i.e.: Any Deep Vein Thromboembolism (DVT) (Proximal and/or Distal), Non Fatal Pulmonary Embolism (PE), Death of All Causes Per Protocol Population
measure.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography
measure.population: The primary efficacy analysis was based on the per protocol (PP) population and included subjects who were valid for the modified intent to treat (MITT) population, had an adequate assessment of thromboembolism that, in case of a positive finding, was done not later than 36 hours after stop of study drug, and had no major protocol deviations.

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: rivaroxaban is inferior to the comparator, ie, the incidence of the primary efficacy endpoint in the rivaroxaban group is larger by more than 4% (absolute) compared to the comparator group.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (one-sided).

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: The incidence of the primary efficacy endpoint is equal in the rivaroxaban group and the comparator group. P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (two-sided).

outcome.title: Composite Endpoint of Total VTE i.e.: Any DVT (Proximal and/or Distal), Non Fatal PE, Death of All Causes Per Modified Intent to Treat Population.
outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE), ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography
outcome.population: A subject was considered valid for the MITT analysis if the subject was valid for the safety analysis, had undergone the appropriate surgery, and had an adequate assessment of thromboembolism

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: The incidence of the major VTE is equal in the rivaroxaban group and the comparator group. P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (two-sided)
Null hypothesis: rivaroxaban is inferior to the comparator, ie, the incidence of the major VTE in the rivaroxaban group is larger by more than 1.5% (absolute) compared to the comparator group.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (one-sided).

outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography, anesthesia and surgery reports, number of transfusions
outcome.population: The net clinical benefit population comprised all subjects either valid for MITT analysis of major VTE or who showed treatment-emergent major bleeding.

measure.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography, anesthesia and surgery reports, number of transfusions

analysis.estimate_desc: Exact methods for difference to Enoxaparin

outcome.title: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint That Results From the Primary Endpoint by Substituting VTE Related Death for All Death Per Protocol Population.
outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography
outcome.population: The PP population included subjects who were valid for the modified intent to treat (MITT) population, had an adequate assessment of thromboembolism that, in case of a positive finding, was done not later than 36 hours after stop of study drug, and had no major protocol deviations

group.title: Rivaroxaban 10 mg Once Daily (OD) (Xarelto, BAY59-7939)
group.description: Rivaroxaban (Xarelto, BAY59-7939) 10 mg tablet administered once daily (od) in the evening plus placebo syringes of enoxaparin twice a day (bid) administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

group.title: Enoxaparin 30 mg Twice a Day (Bid)
group.description: Placebo tablet of rivaroxaban administered once daily in the evening plus syringes of enoxaparin active substance 30 mg twice a day administered once in the morning and once in the evening.

measure.title: Incidence of the Composite Endpoint That Results From the Primary Endpoint by Substituting VTE Related Death for All Death Per Protocol Population.
measure.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography
measure.population: The PP population included subjects who were valid for the modified intent to treat (MITT) population, had an adequate assessment of thromboembolism that, in case of a positive finding, was done not later than 36 hours after stop of study drug, and had no major protocol deviations

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: The incidence rate is equal in the rivaroxaban group and the comparator group. P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (two-sided)
Null hypothesis: rivaroxaban is inferior to the comparator, ie, the incidence rate in the rivaroxaban group is larger by more than 4% (absolute) compared to the comparator group.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (one-sided).

measure.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessment of bilateral venography, clinical signs of DVT and PE, ultrasound, clinical chemistry and coagulation factors, autopsy report, electrocardiogram (ECG), pulmonary angiography, perfusion/ventilation lung scintigraphy, chest radiography, computed tomography
measure.population: The PP population included subjects who were valid for the modified intent to treat (MITT) population, had an adequate assessment of thromboembolism that, in case of a positive finding, was done not later than 36 hours after stop of study drug, and had no major protocol deviations

analysis.groups_desc: Null hypothesis: The incidence rate is equal in the rivaroxaban group and the comparator group. P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (two-sided)
Null hypothesis: rivaroxaban is inferior to the comparator, ie, the incidence rate in the rivaroxaban group is larger by more than 1.5% (absolute) compared to the comparator group.
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: P-values were calculated based on the Mantel-Haenszel weighted estimator (one-sided).

outcome.title: Treatment-emergent Major Bleedings Per Safety Population.
outcome.description: Blinded, adjudicated assessments of all available information (eg, anesthesia and surgery reports, laboratory results, number of transfusions, autopsy report)
outcome.time_frame: from start of double-blind study medication to last dose of double-blind study medication plus two days. The average duration of double-blind treatment was 12 days in each treatment group (safety population).
outcome.population: The safety population comprised those subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: Rivaroxaban 10 mg Once Daily (OD) (Xarelto, BAY59-7939)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
